comment: AMAZING PROFESSOR. 10/10 so nice and funny. Class is tough, but she's always there to help and can be flexible at times. She's a tough grader, but her honesty and stellar feedback almost ensures you'll do better on your next assignment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Incredible professor. If I could take Dr. Campbell for each of my classes I would. Highly recommend her and The Coles Scholars Program if you get the chosen to be apart of it. Dr. Campbell certainly changed my pathway for my life and I am forever grateful as she is not just a professor but a mentor and genuine person who wants the best for you!

Dr. C's combo of work experience and teaching make her a phenomenal professor and mentor (to this day, I'll still phone her up and ask for career advice...). Classes provide an opportunity to learn via real world assignments. A good grade comes from hard work, a great grade comes from going the extra mile. Highly recommend Dr. C's class!

Dr. Campbell encourages her students to be a great version of themselves. She wants you to learn & challenge yourself everyday. Come to class prepared to participate in discussion. You need to earn your A by adding value to projects and assignments. She is also a great human outside of the classroom. She cares about you and wants to see you succeed

Dr. Campbell is by far the best professor I have had at KSU. She is extremely up-to-date with the business world and curates her class so that what you learn is more than just reciting a text. She expects a lot out of you because your employer is going to expect a lot out of you and she also cares a ton about her students. Highly recommend.

Dr. Campbell is a reasonable professor.  She is to the point when it comes to feedback, sometimes even a little gruff, but the feedback is constructive and has helped me to better understand and complete assignments, and to think about what is being asked.  I would take her again as she's funny, easy going, and seems to enjoy teaching.

I took this online and she was literally the most unorganized professor I have had yet. She gave us the topic to the group project about 3 weeks before it was due and didn't grade based upon what she told us to do. Very confusing. There are 2 tests that account for 50 percent of your grade, one of them on campus and the first one online. Good luck.

My biggest complaint how unorganized she is. This by far the most disorganized class Iâ€™ve taken. The discussion only open the day before is due or the day of, she never posts grades on time, the quizzes are very hard even though there is plenty of time you can use the book.

I can honestly say I hardly learned anything from this class.  The only info that I found interesting was the things the professor didn't perform herself (guest speakers, videos, etc.). I often had no idea what the professor expected for assignments, and the syllabus changed so much that it felt unorganized. I made an A, but I don't recommend her.

This was a class on leadership.  Workload was not heavy and she was easy to work with.  She changed the syllabus a few times during the semester, which made it hard to keep up w/ your grade. Take her online course. There were a couple of group cases.  She gave extra points for audio work on your powerpoint presentations. I'd take her classes again!

Her class is just fun, as is she. She can take a joke, and pick on you too. An interesting thing is she is a Dr. really she is, got it from UGA. So she is smart.  Oh and she is kinda easy on the eyes but cant cook, just ask. So just take the class
Very good professor, very helpful. I took her online class and it was great, she responds superfast. Work load is more that average but very well worth it.
